definition:
The capability of an AI
system to interpret and execute instructions provided in natural language
prompts.
opposite_reasoning: PromptIgnoring is the strongest semantic opposite for Fisher-LDA steering purposes. It represents the direct complementary behavior: systematically failing to interpret or execute prompt instructions vs. successfully doing so. This opposition is maximally useful for AI safety monitoring - detecting when systems deviate from instruction-following behavior. While it doesn't exist in standard ontologies, it's the most conceptually pure opposite and should be added to layers as the negative anchor for the PromptFollowing axis. The μ+ - μ- vector would capture the essential difference between instruction-adherent and instruction-ignoring behavior.
